snippet: Skills honed during decades spent in one career can be relevant to strikingly different positions, experts say.
abstract: Experts say that skills honed during decades spent in one career can be relevant to strikingly different positions for retirees looking for second act in their older years; many are surprised that their expertise is more transferable than they had assumed, and that reinventing themselves is not as difficult or even necessary.
lead_paragraph: Skills honed during decades spent in one career can be relevant to strikingly different positions, experts say.

headline.main: For Some Retirees, a Second Act Is Easier Than Expected
headline.print_headline: For Some Retirees, a Second Act Is Easier Than Expected
